content.content:
1→# CipherBox Design System
     2→
     3→**Source:** `designs/cipher-box-design.pen`
     4→**Last Updated:** 2026-01-30
     5→**Status:** Active design system reference
     6→
     7→This document serves as the persistent design context for UI mockup generation. Load this file before any Pencil MCP interaction to ensure consistent outputs.
     8→
     9→## Design Tokens
    10→
    11→### Colors
    12→
    13→| Hex Code  | Opacity | Usage                    | CSS Variable           |
    14→| --------- | ------- | ------------------------ | ---------------------- |
    15→| `#000000` | 100%    | Background, surfaces     | `--color-background`   |
    16→| `#00D084` | 100%    | Primary accent, borders  | `--color-primary`      |
    17→| `#00D084` | 40%     | Glow effects             | `--color-glow`         |
    18→| `#006644` | 100%    | Secondary text, muted    | `--color-text-muted`   |
    19→| `#003322` | 100%    | Row separators, dividers | `--color-border-muted` |
    20→
    21→### Typography
    22→
    23→| Size | Weight | Usage                | CSS Variable       |
    24→| ---- | ------ | -------------------- | ------------------ |
    25→| 10px | 600    | Status text, labels  | `--font-size-xs`   |
    26→| 11px | 400    | Body text, metadata  | `--font-size-sm`   |
    27→| 11px | 600    | Button text, headers | `--font-size-sm`   |
    28→| 12px | 400    | File names           | `--font-size-base` |
    29→| 14px | 600    | App name, section    | `--font-size-md`   |
    30→| 18px | 700    | Prompt character     | `--font-size-lg`   |
    31→
    32→**Font Family:** `JetBrains Mono`
    33→
    34→### Spacing Scale
    35→
    36→| Value | Usage                     | CSS Variable    |
    37→| ----- | ------------------------- | --------------- |
    38→| 8px   | Button padding (vertical) | `--spacing-xs`  |
    39→| 10px  | Row padding (vertical)    | `--spacing-sm`  |
    40→| 12px  | Header padding, gaps      | `--spacing-md`  |
    41→| 16px  | Button padding (h), gaps  | `--spacing-lg`  |
    42→| 20px  | Header item gaps          | `--spacing-xl`  |
    43→| 24px  | Content padding           | `--spacing-2xl` |
    44→
    45→### Borders & Effects
    46→
    47→| Property     | Value                | Usage                    |
    48→| ------------ | -------------------- | ------------------------ |
    49→| Thickness    | 1px                  | All borders              |
    50→| Radius       | 0 (sharp corners)    | Terminal aesthetic       |
    51→| Glow         | `0 0 10px #00D08466` | Status dot, active items |
    52→| Border align | `inside`             | Consistent sizing        |
    53→
    54→## App Layout
    55→
    56→### Desktop (1440 x 900)
    57→
    58→```text
    59→┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
    60→│  > CIPHERBOX                    ● [CONNECTED] user@matrix.cloud │
    61→├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
    62→│  ~/storage/documents/projects                                   │
    63→│  ┌─────────┐ ┌───────────┐ ┌───────────┐                       │
    64→│  │--upload │ │ --new-dir │ │ --refresh │                       │
    65→│  └─────────┘ └───────────┘ └───────────┘                       │
    66→│  ┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐│
    67→│  │ NAME                    SIZE      TYPE       MODIFIED       ││
    68→│  ├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤│
    69→│  │ [DIR] ..               --        directory  --              ││
    70→│  │ [DIR] backup_archives  4.2 GB    directory  2026-01-15      ││
    71→│  │ [FILE] report.pdf      2.4 MB    document   2026-01-20      ││
    72→│  │ [FILE] data.enc        156 KB    encrypted  2026-01-22      ││
    73→│  └─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘│
    74→└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
    75→```
    76→
    77→### Component Hierarchy
    78→
    79→```text
    80→frame (root - 1440x900)
    81→├── header (n386r)
    82→│   ├── headerLeft (zNr0C)
    83→│   │   ├── prompt (D7afA) - ">"
    84→│   │   └── appName (iJ5Gn) - "CIPHERBOX"
    85→│   └── headerRight (VA9WI)
    86→│       ├── statusDot (MhpBr) - with glow effect
    87→│       ├── statusText (8u2AP) - "[CONNECTED]"
    88→│       └── userInfo (Mwofn) - email
    89→├── mainContent (zRTYl)
    90→│   ├── breadcrumbBar (HLKjX)
    91→│   ├── controlBar (uMUQZ)
    92→│   │   ├── btnUpload (1nlwl) - primary filled
    93→│   │   ├── btnNewFolder (5usp9) - outline
    94→│   │   └── btnRefresh (aa0ZP) - outline
    95→│   └── fileListContainer (A87rp)
    96→│       ├── fileListHeader (JIRd2)
    97→│       └── rows (7tF1E, MKlFi, ...)
    98→```
    99→
   100→## Component Library
   101→
   102→### Header
   103→
   104→| Property   | Value                             |
   105→| ---------- | --------------------------------- |
   106→| Background | `#000000`                         |
   107→| Border     | 1px bottom `#00D084`              |
   108→| Padding    | 12px 24px                         |
   109→| Layout     | horizontal, space-between, center |
   110→
   111→### Button - Primary (Filled)
   112→
   113→| Property   | Value               |
   114→| ---------- | ------------------- |
   115→| Background | `#00D084`           |
   116→| Text color | `#000000`           |
   117→| Padding    | 8px 16px            |
   118→| Font       | JetBrains Mono 11px |
   119→| Weight     | 600                 |
   120→
   121→### Button - Secondary (Outline)
   122→
   123→| Property   | Value               |
   124→| ---------- | ------------------- |
   125→| Background | transparent         |
   126→| Border     | 1px `#00D084`       |
   127→| Text color | `#00D084`           |
   128→| Padding    | 8px 16px            |
   129→| Font       | JetBrains Mono 11px |
   130→| Weight     | 400                 |
   131→
   132→### File Row
   133→
   134→| Property       | Value                     |
   135→| -------------- | ------------------------- |
   136→| Padding        | 10px 16px                 |
   137→| Border         | 1px bottom `#003322`      |
   138→| Icon color     | `#00D084`                 |
   139→| Name color     | `#00D084`                 |
   140→| Metadata color | `#006644`                 |
   141→| Column widths  | flex, 120px, 120px, 180px |
   142→
   143→### Status Indicator
   144→
   145→| Property | Value                 |
   146→| -------- | --------------------- |
   147→| Size     | 8px circle            |
   148→| Fill     | `#00D084`             |
   149→| Glow     | 10px blur `#00D08466` |
   150→
   151→## Interaction Patterns
   152→
   153→### Hover States
   154→
   155→- **Buttons:** Subtle brightness increase
   156→- **File rows:** Background highlight (very subtle `#001a11`)
   157→- **Links:** Underline
   158→
   159→### Focus States
   160→
   161→- **Inputs:** 1px `#00D084` outline
   162→- **Buttons:** Same as hover + focus ring
   163→
   164→### Loading States
   165→
   166→- **Skeleton:** Pulsing `#003322` blocks
   167→- **Spinner:** Terminal-style cursor blink or `[...]`
   168→
   169→### Error States
   170→
   171→- **Color:** `#EF4444` (red) for errors
   172→- **Border:** 1px `#EF4444`
   173→- **Text:** `#EF4444` for error messages
   174→
   175→## Design Decision Log
   176→
   177→Record design decisions made during discuss-phase sessions.
   178→
   179→| Date       | Phase | Decision                                  | Rationale                |
   180→| ---------- | ----- | ----------------------------------------- | ------------------------ |
   181→| 2026-01-30 | -     | Initial design system extracted from .pen | Baseline for consistency |
   182→
   183→---
   184→
   185→## Usage in Agents
   186→
   187→### Loading Design Context (Required First Step)
   188→
   189→```typescript
   190→// Before ANY Pencil MCP call, load this document
   191→const designContext = await read('designs/DESIGN.md');
   192→
   193→// Extract tokens for use in prompts
   194→const tokens = {
   195→  colors: {
   196→    background: '#000000',
   197→    primary: '#00D084',
   198→    glow: '#00D08466',
   199→    textMuted: '#006644',
   200→    borderMuted: '#003322',
   201→  },
   202→  typography: {
   203→    fontFamily: 'JetBrains Mono',
   204→    sizes: { xs: 10, sm: 11, base: 12, md: 14, lg: 18 },
   205→    weights: { normal: 400, semibold: 600, bold: 700 },
   206→  },
   207→  spacing: { xs: 8, sm: 10, md: 12, lg: 16, xl: 20, '2xl': 24 },
   208→  borders: { thickness: 1, radius: 0 },
   209→};
   210→```
   211→
   212→### Creating Consistent Designs
   213→
   214→Always use tokens from this file when creating new designs:
   215→
   216→```typescript
   217→await mcp__pencil__create_design({
   218→  // Use ONLY colors from design system
   219→  fill: tokens.colors.background,
   220→  stroke: { thickness: tokens.borders.thickness, fill: tokens.colors.primary },
   221→
   222→  // Use spacing scale
   223→  padding: [tokens.spacing.sm, tokens.spacing.lg],
   224→  gap: tokens.spacing.md,
   225→
   226→  // Use typography
   227→  fontFamily: tokens.typography.fontFamily,
   228→  fontSize: tokens.typography.sizes.sm,
   229→});
   230→```
   231→
   232→---
   233→
   234→_Design system extracted from cipher-box-design.pen_
   235→_Maintained by ui-design-discusser agent_
   236→

---
name: gsd:add-phase
description: Add phase to end of current milestone in roadmap
argument-hint: <description>
--
---

<objective>
Add a new integer phase to the end of the current milestone in the roadmap.
--
---
name: gsd:add-todo
description: Capture idea or task as todo from current conversation context
argument-hint: [optional description]
--
---

<objective>
Capture an idea, task, or issue that surfaces during a GSD session as a structured todo for later work.
--
---
name: gsd:audit-milestone
description: Audit milestone completion against original intent before archiving
argument-hint: "[version]"
--
---

<objective>
Verify milestone achieved its definition of done. Check requirements coverage, cross-phase integration, and end-to-end flows.
--
---
name: gsd:check-todos
description: List pending todos and select one to work on
argument-hint: [area filter]
--
---

<objective>
List all pending todos, allow selection, load full context for the selected todo, and route to appropriate action.
--
---

Would you like to:

--
---
type: prompt
name: gsd:complete-milestone
description: Archive completed milestone and prepare for next version
--
---

<objective>
Mark milestone {{version}} complete, archive to milestones/, and update ROADMAP.md and REQUIREMENTS.md.
--
---
name: gsd:debug
description: Systematic debugging with persistent state across context resets
argument-hint: [issue description]
--
---

<objective>
Debug issues using scientific method with subagent isolation.
--
---
name: gsd:discuss-phase
description: Gather phase context through adaptive questioning before planning. For UI phases, generates design mockups via Pencil MCP for ideation.
argument-hint: '<phase>'
--
---

<objective>
Extract implementation decisions that downstream agents need — researcher and planner will use CONTEXT.md to know what to investigate and what choices are locked.
--
---
name: gsd:execute-phase
description: Execute all plans in a phase with wave-based parallelization
argument-hint: "<phase-number> [--gaps-only]"
--

content.content:
1→<purpose>
     2→Execute a phase prompt (PLAN.md) and create the outcome summary (SUMMARY.md).
     3→</purpose>
     4→
     5→<required_reading>
     6→Read STATE.md before any operation to load project context.
     7→
     8→@./.claude/get-shit-done/references/git-integration.md
     9→</required_reading>
    10→
    11→<process>
    12→
    13→<step name="load_project_state" priority="first">
    14→Before any operation, read project state:
    15→
    16→```bash
    17→cat .planning/STATE.md 2>/dev/null
    18→```
    19→
    20→**If file exists:** Parse and internalize:
    21→
    22→- Current position (phase, plan, status)
    23→- Accumulated decisions (constraints on this execution)
    24→- Blockers/concerns (things to watch for)
    25→- Brief alignment status
    26→
    27→**If file missing but .planning/ exists:**
    28→
    29→```
    30→STATE.md missing but planning artifacts exist.
    31→Options:
    32→1. Reconstruct from existing artifacts
    33→2. Continue without project state (may lose accumulated context)
    34→```
    35→
    36→**If .planning/ doesn't exist:** Error - project not initialized.
    37→
    38→This ensures every execution has full project context.
    39→</step>
    40→
    41→<step name="identify_plan">
    42→Find the next plan to execute:
    43→- Check roadmap for "In progress" phase
    44→- Find plans in that phase directory
    45→- Identify first plan without corresponding SUMMARY
    46→
    47→```bash
    48→cat .planning/ROADMAP.md
    49→# Look for phase with "In progress" status
    50→# Then find plans in that phase
    51→ls .planning/phases/XX-name/*-PLAN.md 2>/dev/null | sort
    52→ls .planning/phases/XX-name/*-SUMMARY.md 2>/dev/null | sort
    53→```
    54→
    55→**Logic:**
    56→
    57→- If `01-01-PLAN.md` exists but `01-01-SUMMARY.md` doesn't → execute 01-01
    58→- If `01-01-SUMMARY.md` exists but `01-02-SUMMARY.md` doesn't → execute 01-02
    59→- Pattern: Find first PLAN file without matching SUMMARY file
    60→
    61→**Decimal phase handling:**
    62→
    63→Phase directories can be integer or decimal format:
    64→
    65→- Integer: `.planning/phases/01-foundation/01-01-PLAN.md`
    66→- Decimal: `.planning/phases/01.1-hotfix/01.1-01-PLAN.md`
    67→
    68→Parse phase number from path (handles both formats):
    69→
    70→```bash
    71→# Extract phase number (handles XX or XX.Y format)
    72→PHASE=$(echo "$PLAN_PATH" | grep -oE '[0-9]+(\.[0-9]+)?-[0-9]+')
    73→```
    74→
    75→SUMMARY naming follows same pattern:
    76→
    77→- Integer: `01-01-SUMMARY.md`
    78→- Decimal: `01.1-01-SUMMARY.md`
    79→
    80→Confirm with user if ambiguous.

content.content:
1→# CipherBox - Claude AI Rules
     2→
     3→## Project Context
     4→
     5→CipherBox is a **technology demonstrator** for privacy-first encrypted cloud storage using IPFS/IPNS and Web3Auth. It is not a commercial product.
     6→
     7→## Documentation Structure
     8→
     9→| Document                                                     | Purpose                                    |
    10→| ------------------------------------------------------------ | ------------------------------------------ |
    11→| `00-Preliminary-R&D/Documentation/PRD.md`                    | Product requirements, user journeys, scope |
    12→| `00-Preliminary-R&D/Documentation/TECHNICAL_ARCHITECTURE.md` | Encryption, key hierarchy, system design   |
    13→| `00-Preliminary-R&D/Documentation/API_SPECIFICATION.md`      | Backend endpoints, database schema         |
    14→| `00-Preliminary-R&D/Documentation/DATA_FLOWS.md`             | Sequence diagrams, test vectors            |
    15→| `00-Preliminary-R&D/Documentation/CLIENT_SPECIFICATION.md`   | Web UI, desktop app specs                  |
    16→| `00-Preliminary-R&D/Documentation/IMPLEMENTATION_ROADMAP.md` | Week-by-week development plan              |
    17→
    18→## Finalized Specifications
    19→
    20→**Current Version:** 1.11.1
    21→**Status:** Finalized (2026-01-20)
    22→
    23→### ⚠️ IMPORTANT: Do Not Edit Preliminary/Documentation Files
    24→
    25→All files in `00-Preliminary-R&D/Documentation/` are **FINALIZED** specifications (version 1.10.0, status: Finalized). These documents represent the agreed-upon design and should **NOT** be modified.
    26→**If you need to make changes:**
    27→
    28→- New implementation documentation should be created in a separate location
    29→- Working notes and updates belong in `.planning/` or project-specific directories
    30→- Do not modify version numbers or content in `00-Preliminary-R&D/Documentation/` unless explicityly authorized.
    31→
    32→## Terminology Standards
    33→
    34→Always use consistent terminology:
    35→
    36→| Correct                   | Avoid                                              |
    37→| ------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------- |
    38→| `publicKey`               | `pubkey`, `user_pubkey`, `ownerPublicKey`          |
    39→| `privateKey`              | `privkey`, `user_private_key`                      |
    40→| `rootFolderKey`           | `rootKey`, `root_folder_key`                       |
    41→| `ipnsName`                | IPNS entry (for identifier)                        |
    42→| `ipnsRecord`              | IPNS entry (for data structure)                    |
    43→| `folderKey`               | `subfolderKey` (unless specifically for subfolder) |
    44→| `fileKey`                 | `file_key`                                         |
    45→| `keyEpoch`                | `epoch`, `key_epoch`                               |
    46→| `encryptedIpnsPrivateKey` | `encrypted_ipns_key`, `ipns_key_encrypted`         |
    47→| `teePublicKey`            | `tee_pubkey`, `TEE_public_key`                     |
    48→
    49→## Critical Security Rules
    50→
    51→1. **Never** suggest storing `privateKey` in localStorage/sessionStorage
    52→2. **Never** suggest logging sensitive keys
    53→3. **Never** suggest sending unencrypted keys to server
    54→4. **Always** use ECIES for key wrapping
    55→5. **Always** use AES-256-GCM for content encryption
    56→6. The server NEVER has access to plaintext or unencrypted keys
    57→7. **Always** encrypt `ipnsPrivateKey` with TEE public key before sending for republishing
    58→8. TEE decrypts IPNS keys in hardware only, signs, and immediately discards
    59→
    60→## API Development Workflow
    61→
    62→When working on `apps/api` code:
    63→
    64→1. **After modifying API endpoints, DTOs, or controllers**, regenerate the API client to keep the web app in sync:
    65→
    66→   ```bash
    67→   pnpm api:generate
    68→   ```
    69→
    70→   This command generates the OpenAPI spec from the API, creates the typed client for the web app, and runs lint fixes.
    71→
    72→2. **Always run `pnpm api:generate` before completing a feature** that touches the API to ensure type safety across the monorepo.
    73→
    74→3. **Commit the regenerated client files** (`apps/web/src/api/`) along with your API changes.
    75→
    76→## Code Generation Guidelines
    77→
    78→When generating code for CipherBox:
    79→
    80→1. Use TypeScript for all JavaScript code
    81→2. Use `Uint8Array` for binary data, not strings
    82→3. Use Web Crypto API for browser encryption
    83→4. Use camelCase for API fields, snake_case for database columns
    84→5. Include proper error handling for crypto operations
    85→6. Clear sensitive data from memory after use
    86→
    87→## Architecture Decisions
    88→
    89→- **Auth:** Web3Auth for key derivation, CipherBox backend for tokens
    90→- **Storage:** IPFS via Pinata for files, IPNS for metadata (all relayed via CipherBox API)
    91→- **Encryption:** Client-side only, server is zero-knowledge
    92→- **Sync:** IPNS polling (30s interval), no push infrastructure
    93→- **Desktop:** FUSE mount for transparent file access
    94→- **TEE Republishing:** Phala Cloud (primary) / AWS Nitro (fallback) for automatic IPNS republishing every 3 hours
    95→- **Key Epochs:** TEE public keys rotate with 4-week grace period for seamless migration
    96→
    97→## Out of Scope (v1.0)
    98→
    99→Do not implement or suggest implementations for:
   100→

content.content:
1→---
     2→name: gsd-verifier
     3→description: Verifies phase goal achievement through goal-backward analysis. Checks codebase delivers what phase promised, not just that tasks completed. Creates VERIFICATION.md report.
     4→tools: Read, Bash, Grep, Glob
     5→color: green
     6→---
     7→
     8→<role>
     9→You are a GSD phase verifier. You verify that a phase achieved its GOAL, not just completed its TASKS.
    10→
    11→Your job: Goal-backward verification. Start from what the phase SHOULD deliver, verify it actually exists and works in the codebase.
    12→
    13→**Critical mindset:** Do NOT trust SUMMARY.md claims. SUMMARYs document what Claude SAID it did. You verify what ACTUALLY exists in the code. These often differ.
    14→</role>
    15→
    16→<core_principle>
    17→**Task completion ≠ Goal achievement**
    18→
    19→A task "create chat component" can be marked complete when the component is a placeholder. The task was done — a file was created — but the goal "working chat interface" was not achieved.
    20→
    21→Goal-backward verification starts from the outcome and works backwards:
    22→
    23→1. What must be TRUE for the goal to be achieved?
    24→2. What must EXIST for those truths to hold?
    25→3. What must be WIRED for those artifacts to function?
    26→
    27→Then verify each level against the actual codebase.
    28→</core_principle>
    29→
    30→<verification_process>
    31→
    32→## Step 0: Check for Previous Verification
    33→
    34→Before starting fresh, check if a previous VERIFICATION.md exists:
    35→
    36→```bash
    37→cat "$PHASE_DIR"/*-VERIFICATION.md 2>/dev/null
    38→```
    39→
    40→**If previous verification exists with `gaps:` section → RE-VERIFICATION MODE:**
    41→
    42→1. Parse previous VERIFICATION.md frontmatter
    43→2. Extract `must_haves` (truths, artifacts, key_links)
    44→3. Extract `gaps` (items that failed)
    45→4. Set `is_re_verification = true`
    46→5. **Skip to Step 3** (verify truths) with this optimization:
    47→   - **Failed items:** Full 3-level verification (exists, substantive, wired)
    48→   - **Passed items:** Quick regression check (existence + basic sanity only)
    49→
    50→**If no previous verification OR no `gaps:` section → INITIAL MODE:**

content.text:
Perfect! Now I have a comprehensive understanding. Let me compile this into a detailed report.

## Pencil MCP Design Verification Integration in CipherBox

Based on my exploration, here's a comprehensive overview of how Pencil MCP is integrated into the GSD workflow:

### **1. Design File Structure**

**Primary design file:**
- `/Users/michael/Code/cipher-box/designs/cipher-box-design.pen` (1MB Pencil design file)
- `/Users/michael/Code/cipher-box/designs/DESIGN.md` (Design system tokens extracted for agent reference)

The DESIGN.md file serves as a persistent context document that agents must load BEFORE any Pencil MCP interaction to ensure consistency.

### **2. Three Specialized UI Agents**

The workflow uses three distinct agents for UI work:

#### **A. ui-design-discusser** (Magenta)
- **Purpose:** Generates design mockups during discuss-phase
- **Runs in:** Isolated context window (preserves orchestrator's context)
- **Key responsibilities:**
  - Load DESIGN.md FIRST (mandatory)
  - Decompose complex UI into components
  - Generate 2-3 design options using Pencil MCP
  - Organize drafts in "Drafts - Phase N" container on canvas
  - Capture screenshots and save to `.planning/phases/XX-name/screenshots/`
  - Return structured summary (NOT raw Pencil output)
  - Update decision log in DESIGN.md

**Critical workflow:**
1. Load design tokens from DESIGN.md
2. Create/find "Drafts - Phase N" container on canvas
3. Generate options inside drafts container (not scattered)
4. Create in-context views showing options within app layout
5. Capture screenshots via `mcp__pencil__get_screenshot` (returns base64 PNG)
6. Write screenshots to disk using Write tool with base64 encoding
7. Mark selected option with badge after user approval

#### **B. ui-design-researcher** (Magenta)
- **Purpose:** Extracts design specs for planning phase
- **Triggered by:** `/gsd:plan-phase` or `/gsd:research-phase` when UI phase detected
- **Key responsibilities:**
  - Parse `.pen` files (JSON format)
  - Extract design tokens (colors, typography, spacing, effects)
  - Document component hierarchy with frame IDs
  - Identify missing design states
  - Create design-focused RESEARCH.md with verification criteria

**Output format:**
- Color palette with hex codes and CSS token names
- Typography scale with sizes/weights/usage
- Spacing scale with pixel values
- Component inventory with frame IDs and paths
- Responsive breakpoints
- Missing designs flagged for user to create

#### **C. ui-design-verifier** (Green)
- **Purpose:** Verifies implementation matches design specs
- **Three verification layers:**
  1. **Code Verification:** Check CSS values match design hex codes, spacing, typography
  2. **Runtime Verification:** Use Playwright MCP to verify computed styles
  3. **Component Structure:** Verify DOM hierarchy matches design

**Verification workflow:**
```typescript
// 1. Load design specs from Pencil file or RESEARCH.md
// 2. Check CSS implementation
grep -rn "#00D084" apps/web/src/ --include="*.css"

// 3. Verify runtime with Playwright MCP
const styles = await mcp__playwright__evaluate({
  script: `getComputedStyle(document.querySelector('.app-header'))`
});

// 4. Compare against design specs (EXACT values)
// Expected: #000000, got: rgb(0, 0, 0) ✓
// Expected: 12px, got: 10px ✗ (discrepancy logged)
```

**Critical principle:** "Implementation ≠ Design" - Must verify EXACT values (not "looks about right")

### **3. UI Keyword Detection (Three Locations)**

The UI detection regex is maintained in **THREE files** (per MEMORY.md warning):

1. **quick.md:105** - `/gsd:quick` command detection
2. **discuss-phase.md:505** - Phase-level UI detection  
3. **gsd-verifier.md:696** - Verification phase detection

**Regex pattern (must stay synced):**
```bash
grep -iqE "ui|ux|style|restyle|design|layout|component|page|view|screen|display|button|form|modal|dialog|popover|tooltip|toast|dropdown|sidebar|header|footer|nav|menu|card|list|table|grid|icon|badge|avatar|breadcrumb|tab|color|font|typography|spacing|padding|margin|responsive|mobile|css|visual|appearance|interface|frontend|dashboard|browser|drag|drop|dnd|hover|focus|animation|transition|overlay|scroll|carousel|interaction|gesture|click|swipe|resize|collapse|expand|accordion|input|checkbox|radio|select|slider|toggle|switch|picker|upload|panel|drawer|toolbar|statusbar|banner|alert|notification|snackbar|thumbnail|preview|placeholder|skeleton|spinner|progress|loading"
```

This expanded list includes interaction keywords (drag, drop, hover, animation) added in Feb 2026 after a DnD task wasn't detected as UI work.

### **4. Design Workflow Integration Points**

**A. Discuss Phase (discuss-phase.md:505)**
- Detects UI phase from keywords
- Checks for `designs/*.pen` file
- Loads design tokens
- Offers mockup generation (optional, user can decline)
- Spawns `ui-design-discusser` in isolated context

**B. Planning Phase**
- Uses RESEARCH.md design specs to create precise tasks
- Each task includes frame ID references for verification
- Tasks specify exact CSS values from design

**C. Verification Phase (verify-work.md)**
- Prefers Playwright MCP automation over manual testing
- For UI phases: spawns `ui-design-verifier`
- Verifies CSS values, computed styles, visual appearance
- Documents discrepancies with file/line references

### **5. Design System Tokens (DESIGN.md)**

The persistent design context includes:

**Colors:**
- `#000000` - Background
- `#00D084` - Primary accent  
- `#00D08466` - Glow effects (40% opacity)
- `#006644` - Text muted
- `#003322` - Border muted

**Typography:**
- Font: JetBrains Mono
- Sizes: 10px (xs), 11px (sm), 12px (base), 14px (md), 18px (lg)
- Weights: 400 (normal), 600 (semibold), 700 (bold)

**Spacing Scale:** 8, 10, 12, 16, 20, 24 pixels

**Effects:**
- All borders: 1px thickness
- All corners: 0px (sharp, terminal aesthetic)
- Glow: `0 0 10px #00D08466`

### **6. Key Lessons from MEMORY.md**

**Pencil MCP specifics:**
- Changes are **in-memory only** - user must save from Pencil editor
- Ask user to save periodically during long sessions
- After `C()` (copy), must `batch_get` to discover new descendant IDs
- Never `U()` descendants of just-copied node in same batch

**Canvas organization:**
- All drafts go in "Drafts - Phase N" container
- Use `find_empty_space_on_canvas` to position drafts
- Options clearly labeled (Option A, Option B)
- Mark selected option with "✓ SELECTED" badge

**Screenshot workflow:**
- `mcp__pencil__get_screenshot` returns base64 PNG data
- Write to disk using Write tool with `encoding: 'base64'`
- Save to `.planning/phases/XX-name/screenshots/`
- Include paths in structured return

### **7. Verification Patterns Reference**

**Reference document:** `.claude/get-shit-done/references/pencil-design-workflow.md`

**Design-first workflow:**
```
Design (Pencil) → Research (Extract) → Execute (Build) → Verify (Compare)
                                                              ↓
                              ← Fix discrepancies ←────────────┘
```

**Verification with Playwright MCP:**
- Navigate to app
- Set viewport to design dimensions (1440x900)
- Capture screenshots
- Extract computed styles via JavaScript evaluation
- Compare against design specs (exact hex codes, pixel values)
- Document discrepancies with severity

**Fallback without Playwright:**
- Manual verification checklist
- Human verification items documented
- Visual checks that can't be automated

### **Summary**

Pencil MCP is deeply integrated into CipherBox's GSD workflow as the **source of truth** for UI work. The integration includes:

1. **Three specialized agents** with distinct roles (discuss, research, verify)
2. **Design system documentation** (DESIGN.md) loaded before all Pencil interactions
3. **UI keyword detection** synced across three workflow files
4. **Screenshot capture and persistence** for visual reference
5. **Exact value verification** (not approximations) against design specs
6. **Canvas organization** with dedicated draft areas per phase
7. **Automated verification** via Playwright MCP when available

The workflow ensures design consistency, enables visual mockup generation during discussion, and provides rigorous verification that implementation matches design specifications down to the pixel and hex code level.

Perfect! Now I have a comprehensive understanding. Let me compile this into a detailed report.

## Pencil MCP Design Verification Integration in CipherBox

Based on my exploration, here's a comprehensive overview of how Pencil MCP is integrated into the GSD workflow:

### **1. Design File Structure**

**Primary design file:**
- `/Users/michael/Code/cipher-box/designs/cipher-box-design.pen` (1MB Pencil design file)
- `/Users/michael/Code/cipher-box/designs/DESIGN.md` (Design system tokens extracted for agent reference)

The DESIGN.md file serves as a persistent context document that agents must load BEFORE any Pencil MCP interaction to ensure consistency.

### **2. Three Specialized UI Agents**

The workflow uses three distinct agents for UI work:

#### **A. ui-design-discusser** (Magenta)
- **Purpose:** Generates design mockups during discuss-phase
- **Runs in:** Isolated context window (preserves orchestrator's context)
- **Key responsibilities:**
  - Load DESIGN.md FIRST (mandatory)
  - Decompose complex UI into components
  - Generate 2-3 design options using Pencil MCP
  - Organize drafts in "Drafts - Phase N" container on canvas
  - Capture screenshots and save to `.planning/phases/XX-name/screenshots/`
  - Return structured summary (NOT raw Pencil output)
  - Update decision log in DESIGN.md

**Critical workflow:**
1. Load design tokens from DESIGN.md
2. Create/find "Drafts - Phase N" container on canvas
3. Generate options inside drafts container (not scattered)
4. Create in-context views showing options within app layout
5. Capture screenshots via `mcp__pencil__get_screenshot` (returns base64 PNG)
6. Write screenshots to disk using Write tool with base64 encoding
7. Mark selected option with badge after user approval

#### **B. ui-design-researcher** (Magenta)
- **Purpose:** Extracts design specs for planning phase
- **Triggered by:** `/gsd:plan-phase` or `/gsd:research-phase` when UI phase detected
- **Key responsibilities:**
  - Parse `.pen` files (JSON format)
  - Extract design tokens (colors, typography, spacing, effects)
  - Document component hierarchy with frame IDs
  - Identify missing design states
  - Create design-focused RESEARCH.md with verification criteria

**Output format:**
- Color palette with hex codes and CSS token names
- Typography scale with sizes/weights/usage
- Spacing scale with pixel values
- Component inventory with frame IDs and paths
- Responsive breakpoints
- Missing designs flagged for user to create

#### **C. ui-design-verifier** (Green)
- **Purpose:** Verifies implementation matches design specs
- **Three verification layers:**
  1. **Code Verification:** Check CSS values match design hex codes, spacing, typography
  2. **Runtime Verification:** Use Playwright MCP to verify computed styles
  3. **Component Structure:** Verify DOM hierarchy matches design

**Verification workflow:**
```typescript
// 1. Load design specs from Pencil file or RESEARCH.md
// 2. Check CSS implementation
grep -rn "#00D084" apps/web/src/ --include="*.css"

// 3. Verify runtime with Playwright MCP
const styles = await mcp__playwright__evaluate({
  script: `getComputedStyle(document.querySelector('.app-header'))`
});

// 4. Compare against design specs (EXACT values)
// Expected: #000000, got: rgb(0, 0, 0) ✓
// Expected: 12px, got: 10px ✗ (discrepancy logged)
```

**Critical principle:** "Implementation ≠ Design" - Must verify EXACT values (not "looks about right")

### **3. UI Keyword Detection (Three Locations)**

The UI detection regex is maintained in **THREE files** (per MEMORY.md warning):

1. **quick.md:105** - `/gsd:quick` command detection
2. **discuss-phase.md:505** - Phase-level UI detection  
3. **gsd-verifier.md:696** - Verification phase detection

**Regex pattern (must stay synced):**
```bash
grep -iqE "ui|ux|style|restyle|design|layout|component|page|view|screen|display|button|form|modal|dialog|popover|tooltip|toast|dropdown|sidebar|header|footer|nav|menu|card|list|table|grid|icon|badge|avatar|breadcrumb|tab|color|font|typography|spacing|padding|margin|responsive|mobile|css|visual|appearance|interface|frontend|dashboard|browser|drag|drop|dnd|hover|focus|animation|transition|overlay|scroll|carousel|interaction|gesture|click|swipe|resize|collapse|expand|accordion|input|checkbox|radio|select|slider|toggle|switch|picker|upload|panel|drawer|toolbar|statusbar|banner|alert|notification|snackbar|thumbnail|preview|placeholder|skeleton|spinner|progress|loading"
```

This expanded list includes interaction keywords (drag, drop, hover, animation) added in Feb 2026 after a DnD task wasn't detected as UI work.

### **4. Design Workflow Integration Points**

**A. Discuss Phase (discuss-phase.md:505)**
- Detects UI phase from keywords
- Checks for `designs/*.pen` file
- Loads design tokens
- Offers mockup generation (optional, user can decline)
- Spawns `ui-design-discusser` in isolated context

**B. Planning Phase**
- Uses RESEARCH.md design specs to create precise tasks
- Each task includes frame ID references for verification
- Tasks specify exact CSS values from design

**C. Verification Phase (verify-work.md)**
- Prefers Playwright MCP automation over manual testing
- For UI phases: spawns `ui-design-verifier`
- Verifies CSS values, computed styles, visual appearance
- Documents discrepancies with file/line references

### **5. Design System Tokens (DESIGN.md)**

The persistent design context includes:

**Colors:**
- `#000000` - Background
- `#00D084` - Primary accent  
- `#00D08466` - Glow effects (40% opacity)
- `#006644` - Text muted
- `#003322` - Border muted

**Typography:**
- Font: JetBrains Mono
- Sizes: 10px (xs), 11px (sm), 12px (base), 14px (md), 18px (lg)
- Weights: 400 (normal), 600 (semibold), 700 (bold)

**Spacing Scale:** 8, 10, 12, 16, 20, 24 pixels

**Effects:**
- All borders: 1px thickness
- All corners: 0px (sharp, terminal aesthetic)
- Glow: `0 0 10px #00D08466`

### **6. Key Lessons from MEMORY.md**

**Pencil MCP specifics:**
- Changes are **in-memory only** - user must save from Pencil editor
- Ask user to save periodically during long sessions
- After `C()` (copy), must `batch_get` to discover new descendant IDs
- Never `U()` descendants of just-copied node in same batch

**Canvas organization:**
- All drafts go in "Drafts - Phase N" container
- Use `find_empty_space_on_canvas` to position drafts
- Options clearly labeled (Option A, Option B)
- Mark selected option with "✓ SELECTED" badge

**Screenshot workflow:**
- `mcp__pencil__get_screenshot` returns base64 PNG data
- Write to disk using Write tool with `encoding: 'base64'`
- Save to `.planning/phases/XX-name/screenshots/`
- Include paths in structured return

### **7. Verification Patterns Reference**

**Reference document:** `.claude/get-shit-done/references/pencil-design-workflow.md`

**Design-first workflow:**
```
Design (Pencil) → Research (Extract) → Execute (Build) → Verify (Compare)
                                                              ↓
                              ← Fix discrepancies ←────────────┘
```

**Verification with Playwright MCP:**
- Navigate to app
- Set viewport to design dimensions (1440x900)
- Capture screenshots
- Extract computed styles via JavaScript evaluation
- Compare against design specs (exact hex codes, pixel values)
- Document discrepancies with severity

**Fallback without Playwright:**
- Manual verification checklist
- Human verification items documented
- Visual checks that can't be automated

### **Summary**

Pencil MCP is deeply integrated into CipherBox's GSD workflow as the **source of truth** for UI work. The integration includes:

1. **Three specialized agents** with distinct roles (discuss, research, verify)
2. **Design system documentation** (DESIGN.md) loaded before all Pencil interactions
3. **UI keyword detection** synced across three workflow files
4. **Screenshot capture and persistence** for visual reference
5. **Exact value verification** (not approximations) against design specs
6. **Canvas organization** with dedicated draft areas per phase
7. **Automated verification** via Playwright MCP when available

The workflow ensures design consistency, enables visual mockup generation during discussion, and provides rigorous verification that implementation matches design specifications down to the pixel and hex code level.
